title: Azure Orbital Space unveils software tools for space applications
summary: Microsoft announced the private preview Nov. 17 of a new product, the Azure Orbital Software Development Kit, the latest move by the software giant to play an important role role in the rapidly evolving space sector.

title: Spaceport Cornwall receives first U.K. spaceport license
summary: An English airport has secured the first-of-its-kind spaceport license from a British regulator that brings it one step closer to hosting the country’s first orbital launch.

title: Artemis I releases 10 cubesats, including a Moon lander, for technology and research
summary: The Artemis I mission, the first flight of the Orion spacecraft and SLS, is now underway after a successful launch from Pad 39B at the Kennedy Space Center at 1:47:44 AM EST (06:47:44 UTC) on Nov. 16.

title: Spire Global reveals larger, new-gen 16U satellite bus
summary: Spire Global has unveiled a new-generation satellite bus to meet demand for larger and more capable satellites.

title: Apple bringing SOS via satellite services to Europe in December
summary: Apple is extending its SOS via satellite service for iPhone 14 smartphones to parts of Europe in December, the company said Nov. 15 after bringing the capability online across the United States and Canada.

title: On the NRO’s wish list: AI technologies to manage satellites and data
summary: NRO Director Chris Scolese said the agency wants to use artificial intelligence and machine learning to orchestrate the operation of imaging satellites and to analyze data in orbit

title: SpaceRyde announces multiple launches with ISILaunch
summary: Canadian launch startup SpaceRyde revealed plans Nov. 15 to launch four private commercial flights for ISILaunch, a subsidiary of Innovative Solutions In Space B.V. of the Netherlands.

title: Rocket Factory Augsburg signs deal to test engines at DLR premises
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg has signed a deal allowing it to build and operate its own engine test stand at German Aerospace Center (DLR) premises.

title: Companies have diverging views on the future of European launch
summary: Arianespace and German launch startups Isar Aerospace and Rocket Factory Augsburg are moving towards first launches next year but have mixed views on how the European launch sector has and should develop.

title: Liftoff! NASA’s Artemis I Mega Rocket Launches Orion to Moon
summary: Following a successful launch of NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS), the most powerful rocket in the world, the agency’s Orion spacecraft is on its way to the Moon as part of the Artemis program.
